title: Missverstanden (Incompresa aka Misunderstood, 2014) Ital. with G
description:
Rome, 1984, Aria is nine-year-old girl. On the verge of divorce, Aria's infantile and selfish parents are too preoccupied with their careers and extra-marital affairs to properly tend to any of Aria's needs. While her two older sisters are pampered, Aria is treated with cold indifference. Yet she yearns to love and to be loved. At school, Aria excels academically but is considered a misfit by everyone. She is misunderstood. Aria finds comfort in her cat - Dac and in her best friend - Angelica. Thrown out of both parents' homes, abandoned by all, even her best friend, Aria finally reaches the limit of what she can bear. She makes an unexpected decision in her life.

Semi-autobiographical movie by Asia Argento about her unconventional/chaotic childhood with artist-parents in Rome (Italy).
Her 9-years-old self is wonderfully played by Giulia Salerno and the difficult role of her ambivalent mother is masterfully performed by the great Charlotte Gainsbourg.
Asia Argento: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asia_Argento
Giulia Salerno: https://kat.cr/confirm/url/aHR0cDovL3d3dy5hbGxvY2luZS5mci9wZXJzb25uZS9maWNoZXBlcnNvbm5lLTQzMzQyOS9waG90b3MvZGV0YWlsLz9jbWVkaWFmaWxlPTIxMTExMzUw/
Charlotte Gainsbourg: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlotte_Gainsbourg

Avantgardist Italian cinematography at its best!

More English info and links at Wikipedia article.

674 x 572 is the original resolution on DVD after stripping the black bars left/right/top/bottom.
Don't be fooled by the seemingly low bit rate. If you use the correct Codec/LAV Filter for h265/HEVC you will get the quality just as on the DVD. It's just the best there is and it works great for me with VLC-player as well as ZoomPlayer.
See HEVC.
